title: Analysts Expect Fossil Group Inc (FOSL) Will Post Earnings of -$0.82 Per Share
content: Wall Street brokerages expect that Fossil Group Inc (NASDAQ:FOSL) will post earnings of ($0.82) per share for the current fiscal quarter, Zacks Investment Research reports. Two analysts have issued estimates for Fossil Group’s earnings. The lowest EPS estimate is ($0.90) and the highest is ($0.74). Fossil Group posted earnings of ($0.23) per share in the same quarter last year, which indicates a negative year-over-year growth rate of 256.5%. The business is expected to announce its next quarterly earnings results  on Tuesday, August 14th.    On average, analysts expect that Fossil Group will report full year earnings of ($0.63) per share for the current financial year, with EPS estimates ranging from ($0.80) to ($0.46). For the next year, analysts anticipate that the firm will post earnings of $0.57 per share, with EPS estimates ranging from $0.35 to $0.86. Zacks Investment Research’s earnings per share averages are an average based on a survey of sell-side analysts that cover Fossil Group.    Fossil Group (NASDAQ:FOSL) last released its earnings results on Tuesday, May 8th. The  accessories brand company reported ($0.99) earnings per share for the quarter, missing analysts’ consensus estimates of ($0.96) by ($0.03). The company had revenue of $569.20 million for the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $539.08 million. Fossil Group had a negative net margin of 17.23% and a negative return on equity of 4.36%. The business’s revenue was down 2.2% compared to the same quarter last year. During the same quarter in the previous year, the company posted ($1.00) earnings per share.    A number of analysts have recently weighed in on FOSL shares. BidaskClub downgraded Fossil Group from a “strong-buy” rating to a “buy” rating in a research report on Saturday, April 21st. Zacks Investment Research upgraded Fossil Group from a “hold” rating to a “buy” rating and set a $21.00 target price for the company in a research report on Friday, May 11th. ValuEngine upgraded Fossil Group from a “sell” rating to a “hold” rating in a research report on Wednesday, February 14th. Telsey Advisory Group upped their target price on Fossil Group from $7.00 to $15.00 and gave the company a “market perform” rating in a research report on Wednesday, February 14th. Finally, KeyCorp  reiterated an “overweight” rating and set a $25.00 target price (up from $15.00) on shares of Fossil Group in a research report on Wednesday, February 14th. Four investment analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, three have assigned  a hold rating, two have assigned  a buy rating and one  has given a strong buy rating to the company. The stock  has a consensus rating of “Hold” and a consensus price target of $13.00.  In other news, Chairman Kosta N. Kartsotis sold 174,552 shares of the business’s stock in a transaction on Monday, March 12th. The stock was sold at an average price of $12.70, for a total transaction of $2,216,810.40. The transaction was disclosed in a legal filing with the Securities & Exchange Commission, which is available at the SEC website . Insiders have sold a total of 679,972 shares of company stock valued at $9,041,909 in the last three months. 8.20% of the stock is owned by insiders.    Several institutional investors have recently bought and sold shares of FOSL. Schwab Charles Investment Management Inc. raised its holdings in shares of  Fossil Group by 38.7% during the 4th quarter. Schwab Charles Investment Management Inc. now owns 538,545 shares of the  accessories brand company’s stock worth $4,185,000 after buying an additional 150,380 shares in the last quarter.  Alambic Investment Management L.P. raised its holdings in shares of  Fossil Group by 43.9% during the 4th quarter. Alambic Investment Management L.P. now owns 514,210 shares of the  accessories brand company’s stock worth $3,995,000 after buying an additional 156,910 shares in the last quarter.  Crossmark Global Holdings Inc. increased its holdings in  Fossil Group by 68.7% in the 4th quarter. Crossmark Global Holdings Inc. now owns 24,750 shares of the  accessories brand company’s stock worth $192,000 after purchasing an additional 10,080 shares in the last quarter.  Teacher Retirement System of Texas acquired a new position in  Fossil Group in the 4th quarter worth about $120,000.  Finally, California Public Employees Retirement System increased its holdings in  Fossil Group by 44.8% in the 4th quarter. California Public Employees Retirement System now owns 601,233 shares of the  accessories brand company’s stock worth $4,672,000 after purchasing an additional 186,114 shares in the last quarter. 94.08% of the stock is owned by institutional investors.    Shares of NASDAQ:FOSL traded up $1.82 during trading on Friday, reaching $23.70. 1,976,673 shares of the company traded hands, compared to its average volume of 2,718,456. The company has a market cap of $1.06 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 474.00, a PEG ratio of 18.29 and a beta of -0.11. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.64, a quick ratio of 1.19 and a current ratio of 2.21. Fossil Group has a 52 week low of $5.50 and a 52 week high of $23.77.    About Fossil Group    Fossil Group, Inc, together with its subsidiaries, designs, develops, markets, and distributes consumer fashion accessories. The company's principal products include a line of men's and women's fashion watches and jewelry, handbags, small leather goods, belts, and sunglasses. It offers its products under its proprietary brands, such as FOSSIL, MICHELE, MISFIT, RELIC, SKAGEN, and ZODIAC, as well as under the licensed brands, including ARMANI EXCHANGE, CHAPS, DIESEL, DKNY, EMPORIO ARMANI, KARL LAGERFELD, KATE SPADE NEW YORK, MARC JACOBS, MICHAEL KORS, and TORY BURCH.
